decks.notes: The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm your opponent with fast, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger. Utilizing spells like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage to remove any obstacles in the way, while also utilizing cards like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics to disrupt your opponent's strategy. With a mix of direct damage spells and efficient creatures, this deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of creature and spell-based threats in the Rakdos color combination. The goal is to put pressure on the opponent early with efficient creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Preacher of the Schism, while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck also has removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of powerful legendary creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse adds a powerful late-game threat to close out the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly develop a board presence with efficient and aggressive creatures such as Archon of Emeria and Badgermole Cub, supported by mana acceleration from cards like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like Enduring Innocence and Skyclave Apparition provide removal options. Collected Company allows for explosive plays by searching for additional creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and consistent threats while maintaining control of the board.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly applying pressure on the opponent with low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, while utilizing spells like Fiery Impulse and Stormchaser's Talent for removal and additional damage. The deck also features cards like Academic Dispute and Heroes' Hangout to maintain card advantage and tempo. The key strategy is to efficiently use spells and creatures to deal damage and control the board, ultimately overwhelming the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with efficient creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Voice of Resurgence. Collected Company provides extra value by potentially putting more threats onto the battlefield. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down opponents, while Ouroboroid and Enduring Innocence provide resilience against removal spells. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent access to both colors of mana. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and resilience.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to utilize efficient creatures and disruption spells to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to ramp into bigger threats such as Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent assault.

The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition. It uses Collected Company to help flood the board with creatures and maintain aggression. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing for early plays and aggressive starts. The inclusion of cards like Aven Interrupter and Ouroboroid adds versatility to the deck, giving it options for disruption and evasion. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient attack plan.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of cheap spells and creatures to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear to buff up with spells like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage. Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics help control the board while Stock Up and Stormchaser's Talent provide card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and burn spells to quickly close out the game.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Witch's Oven and Gilded Goose to generate food tokens and enable synergies with Cauldron Familiar, alongside powerful threats like Ygra, Eater of All, the deck aims to control the board while chipping away at the opponent's life total. Traverse the Ulvenwald helps find key pieces while Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay provide versatility in dealing with threats. The deck's main goal is to overwhelm the opponent through a combination of aggression and resource management.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on equipping creatures with powerful equipment, such as Colossus Hammer and Leyline Axe, to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes support cards like Sigarda's Aid and Shadowspear to enhance the effectiveness of these equipment. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Fervent Champion and Kellan, the Fae-Blooded, along with efficient mana base and removal spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient attacks and disrupt their game plan.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of low-cost aggressive creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger, backed up by powerful instant spells like Monstrous Rage, Reckless Rage, and Stock Up. The deck also utilizes card draw and mana acceleration with cards like Stormchaser's Talent, Academic Dispute, and Experimental Synthesizer. The land base is optimized to support a fast and consistent mana base, allowing for swift aggression and quick tempo plays to pressure the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up your graveyard with spells and using them to bring back Arclight Phoenix for repeated damage. It also includes a mix of card draw, removal spells, and versatile spells to help control the board and maintain pressure on your opponent. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and aggressive, aiming to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, it includes flexibility with different types of spells to adapt to various matchups and situations.

The deck focuses on quickly casting spells to return Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard to the battlefield, putting pressure on the opponent with fast and efficient card draw and removal spells. It aims to fill the graveyard with spells to enable the recurring threat of Arclight Phoenix while also disrupting the opponent with targeted removal and disruption spells. The deck utilizes a mix of cantrips, burn spells, and card draw to maintain tempo and control the battlefield, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient interactions.

This aggro deck focuses on establishing a fast board presence with low-cost creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, supported by powerful creatures like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down opponents' strategies. Collected Company provides additional creature advantage, while cards like Aven Interrupter and Selfless Spirit offer protection and utility. The mana base is designed to support the deck's curve efficiently, allowing for consistent aggression and pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this Esper Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber while efficiently removing threats with removal spells like Bloodchief's Thirst and Vanishing Verse. With a mix of powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Raffine, Scheming Seer, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent quickly and close out the game before they can stabilize. The land base is optimized for consistent mana production to ensure the deck can consistently execute its game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly build a board presence and deal damage to the opponent. By using cards like Ensoul Artifact to boost the power of artifacts, as well as cards like Shrapnel Blast and Gleeful Demolition for direct damage, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. The deck also includes cards like Spyglass Siren and Boomerang Basics to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control of the battlefield. Overall, this deck aims to be aggressive and efficient in order to secure a quick victory.
